intro: Tabernaemontana occidentalis, commonly known as the West African star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces berries that contain toxic seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its elegant appearance and fragrant blooms. However, it should be handled with care as all parts of the plant are poisonous.
